newsitem.title: UK: Yorks Water says utility tax unwelcome.
newsitem.headline: Yorks Water says utility tax unwelcome.

text.p: British water and sewerage company Yorkshire Water said a one-off tax on privatised utilities announced by the new Labour government on Wednesday was "unwelcome".
"We feel it is retrospective taxation which is bad news for investors," a company spokesman told Reuters.

Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown, announcing his first budget to parliament, said he aimed to raise a net 4.8 billion stg from a one-off tax on privatised utilities, including the impact of reducing a gas levy to zero.
Yorkshire Water said it had "never made excess profits and our operating profit has been less than that projected by the government when we were privatised in 1989".

The company spokesman added that Yorkshire was "disappointed the government thought fit to extract cash from a business with a massive capital investment programme ahead of it." -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
